tourName: Abu Simbel Sun Festival tour in Egypt
generalInfo: This special 9-day Egypt tour takes in Cairo, Aswan and Luxor, and is timed to coincide with the Sun Festival that takes place in the temples at Abu Simbel twice a year. Egypt is home to a huge variety of ancient monuments from the Pharaonic era. One of the most important, most interesting and most impressive is the temple to Ramses II at Abu Simbel. Ramses II was one of the great Pharaohs, and built temples all over Egypt. The temples in Abu Simbel are particularly interesting because they were constructed, not from blocks and columns, but by cutting and tunnelling into a rock cliff-face. The main entrance tunnel features 4 statues at its end, and incredible care was taken when the temple was built so that twice a year, on the dates of Ramses ascension to the throne, and on his birthday, the rising sun shines right in through the tunnel and lights up just 3 of the statues, leaving the fourth, dedicated to Ptah, the god of Darkness, in shadow. When the Aswan Dam was built and Lake Nasser was flooded, the temples were below the planned water line and a huge project took place to carefully dismantle the temples and rebuild them higher up, out of danger from the rising waters. The allignment of the tunnel was maintained so that to this day the rising sun shines in on the 22nd October and 22nd February each year. Our tour starts in Cairo with a visit to the Great Pyramids and the Sphinx before heading to Aswan where we visit the island temple of Philae and the Aswan Dam. The next morning our Egyptologist tour guide escorts us as we set off very early to get to Abu Simbel in plenty of time for the sunrise. It will be busy, but it is generally well organised so that everyone has the chance to go inside and see the statues in the morning sunlight. After this special experience we return to Aswan and board a traditional Nile felucca for a relaxing cruise down the river on your way towards Luxor in the Nile Valley. Support is provided en-route from our facilities boat with on board toilet, showers and massage deck. An alternative upgrade to an extra night in the hotel in Aswan is available if you prefer. After our night on the felucca we drive on north to Luxor, stopping to see the temple at Edfu en-route. Once in Luxor you will visit the huge temple complex at Karnak, explore the tombs of the Valley of the Kings and Queen Hatchepsut temple, and also have some free time to walk through the markets and relax by the hotel pool before we head back to Cairo. If you'd like to add some time by the Red Sea to this trip, then please contact us for details as extensions are easily arranged from Luxor to Hurghada, and then back to Cairo from there

dayInfo.description: Arrive into Cairo. Transfer to your hotel Upon arrival at Cairo airport, we will meet you and assist you with visa formalities and luggage collection, then transfer you to your hotel near the pyramids. Our rep will help you settle in, then the rest of the day is free at your leisure. If your flight lands early, then you could take a first look at the pyramids with an amazing sound and light show, or perhaps head into downtown Cairo for a Nile dinner cruise and show. | OVERNIGHT

Cairo, Pyramids, Sphinx & Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM) tour Our adventure begins with a visit to the iconic pyramids of Giza. Marvel at the Great Pyramid of Khufu (Cheops), a monumental structure standing tall at 500 feet and spanning 750 feet at its base. Constructed with massive stone blocks and adorned with a hard limestone casing, this architectural masterpiece will leave you speachless. Alongside the Great Pyramid, admire the smaller yet equally impressive pyramids of Khafre (Chephren) and Menkaure (Mycerinus). You'll even have the chance to venture inside the pyramids (limited tickets available for the Great Pyramid) for an unforgettable experience. Next, we'll visit to the magnificent Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM), located near the Pyramids of Giza. Immerse yourself in the wonders of ancient Egypt as you explore the Tutankhamun exhibit and countless other fascinating artifacts. Our expert Egyptologist guide will accompany you throughout your visit, sharing their wealth of knowledge and passion for Egyptian history and culture. Please note

Aswan, Nubian Village, Philae Temple Upon arrival in Aswan we take a short transfer to our hotel overlooking the Nile. The river here is at its most scenic in Egypt, and is dotted with islands and felucca sailing boats. Aswan itself is an intriguing mixture of African and Middle Eastern cultures, and lies in part of the ancient region of Nubia. Many Nubian people still live here and work on the river, and we'll visit a Nubian village away from the main town where we'll walk through narrow alleyways seeing colourfully painted houses, friendly people, wandering animals and enjoy a traditional local lunch. We continue our day with an afternoon tour to the Temple of Philae. This beautiful island temple is dedicated to Isis and was saved from the rising waters of Lake Nasser. It can only be reached by a scenic boat ride. The evening is free at leisure to explore Aswan's various markets and to walk up and down the Corniche on the banks of the Nile. There's also an option to ride a camel across the sands on the far banks of the Nile to St. Simeon's monastery. Those who have chosen to visit Abu Simbel tomorrow should aim for an early night tonight ready for a very early start in the morning. | OVERNIGHT

Abu Simbel Sun Festival, Nile felucca cruise We leave Aswan in the early hours of the morning today and make the drive (approx. 3 hours) to the UNESCO world heritage site at Abu Simbel. These amazing temples built by Ramses II are one of Egypt's main highlights and attractions. We arrive at the temples in plenty of time for some historical explanations by our Egyptologist guide, before going inside the temple while the sun is rising to see how 3 out of the 4 statues at the end of the tunnel are lit up, leaving Ptah, the god of Darkness in shadow. It can be very busy at Abu Simbel on this day so be prepared for a bit of a procession straight in and out to see the statues. After returning to Aswan, we board a traditional felucca sailboat this afternoon for a great day sailing down the Nile. Drifting down the Nile on a felucca is one of Egypt's most enjoyable experiences, and you'll see local rural Egyptian life pass you by. Our Nubian crew will handle the boat and provide entertainment to you on the way, as well as preparing all your meals. Our fully equipped facilities boat will drop by from time to time during the day and moor up with us at night. Our boat has a western toilet and showers on board as well as a modern, hygienic kitchen where the crew will prepare and cook a tasty evening meal. You sleep on the deck of the boat tonight and we provide mattresses, blankets and mosquito nets as required. You can also choose to upgrade your Nile felucca cruise to stay in the hotel in Aswan instead of on board the boat. All other touring remains the same. | OVERNIGHT

Edfu temple & Karnak Temple in Luxor After breakfast on-board we leave behind our felucca crew and take a tour of nearby temple Edfu before driving north to Luxor. Luxor is built on and around the ancient site of Thebes, and has the greatest concentration of ancient ruins in the Nile Valley, if not the world. To the west, across the Nile, lies the City of the Dead, with its mortuary temples and rock carved tombs, and to the east stand the Temples of Luxor and Karnak. After lunch we'll visit the massive temple complex of Karnak , once the religious heart of Thebes and Upper Egypt. It was linked to the town of Luxor by a long sphinx lined avenue, and the temple itself was linked to the Nile via a canal along which sailed the sacred boats of the god Amun. The entrance is via a smaller sphinx-lined avenue, built by Ramesses II, after which you enter the temple proper through the enormous pylon entrance. Inside the large Courtyard are three temples dedicated to the gods Amun, Khous and Mut. The much photographed Hypostyle Hall has an impressive 134 towering columns, each is carved with scenes of gods and pharaohs, and hieroglyphic inscriptions cover the walls. In the evening we'll take a walking tour of the smaller Luxor Temple, which is in the centre of town and is colourfully lit up by night. | OVERNIGHT

Luxor, West Bank tour, free time We have an early start today as we cross the Nile for a tour of Luxor's West Bank. The dusty tombs in the ancient burial site of the Valley of the Kings are still revealing their secrets today and the valley remains one of the world's most important archaeological sites. We will descend into several of these Pharaonic tombs before also visiting Queen Hatchepsut and Medinat Habu temples, and the huge Colossi of Memnon. The rest of the day is then free to relax in your 5-star hotel by the Nile, or head out into Luxor to explore independently. You could do some shopping or browsing in the market, take a felucca trip to nearby Banana island or visit the mummification museum. Additional ancient Egyptian sightseeing is also available if you'd like to learn more about Egyptian history. The Workers Village, Valley of the Queens and Rammesseum on the west bank of the Nile are all worth a visit. Your Egyptologist guide will be happy to arrange any extra visits you may like to do (payable locally). | OVERNIGHT

Luxor, Karnak temple You can enjoy a welcome lie in today after several early starts. Our afternoon tour then explores the huge temple complex at Karnak. This was once the religious centre of Thebes and Upper Egypt and was linked to Luxor by a long sphinx-lined avenue. The whole complex was in turn linked by a canal to the Nile which the sacred boats of the god Amun moved through. We enter the temple through a smaller sphinx-lined avenue built by Ramesses II, before entering the immense pylon entrance. The huge Courtyard that follows contains are three chapels dedicated to the gods Amun, Khous and Mut while the remarkable Hypostyle Hall has 134 towering columns, each carved with scenes of gods and pharaohs. Hieroglyphic inscriptions adorn the walls. There is a huge amount to see here and our Egyptologist guide will give a tour of several hours followed by some free time for you to look around further. In the evening we transfer to the station to catch the overnight sleeper train back to Cairo (approx. 9 hours). | OVERNIGHT

Cairo, optional tours. Back streets of the Khan-el-Khalili bazaar We arrive back into Cairo this morning and then you have time to explore Cairo as you choose or you may take an optional tour. These include a city tour visiting Coptic Cairo, the Citadel and Mohamed Ali Mosque, or a half day tour to Saqqara, Dashour and Memphis to learn more about the history and evolution of pyramid building. Other full day options further afield include a visit to the colonial city of Alexandria on the Mediterranean, or a trip into the desert outside Cairo to see the World Heritage Site of the Valley of the Whales at Wadi Rayan. In the late afternoon we take a guided walk through the back streets and bazaars in central Cairo. We'll walk through the huge Bab al-Futuh gateway and explore streets dedicated to metalwork, spices, pottery, fabric, jewellery and anything else you can imagine as we gradually enter the more touristy Khan-el-Khalili bazaar. We'll have time for a break to try some tea and a shisha pipe and perhaps enjoy an early dinner of Egypt's unofficial national dish, Kushari. Finally we transfer you back to your hotel. | OVERNIGHT
Cairo. Departure transfer to the airport Free day. Transfer to the airport for your departure flight. | OVERNIGHT

generalInfo:

During this holiday, enjoy the Giza pyramids of Cheops, Chefren and Mykerinus in addition to the best collection of the young King Tutankhamen at the Egyptian Museum. Moreover; travel by first class sleeping train to Luxor from Giza railway station approximately 12 hours by train where you can see many archaeological sites like Valley of the Kings and Hatshpsute Temple. Then enjoy the famous sites of Aswan and Abu Simbel.

dayInfo.description: Our representative will meet & assist you at Cairo International Airport. After that you will be transferred to your hotel by a private air-conditioned vehicle. Upon arrival at the hotel he will check you in and give detailed information concerning your tomorrow’s trip. Overnight in Cairo.

After enjoying a delicious wholesome breakfast at your hotel, your personal guide will take you to the Giza Plateau to start your journey by marveling at one of the Seven Wonders of the World, the Great Pyramids of Giza. Visit the iconic Sphinx and Valley Temple. After your pyramid visit, you’ll go for lunch at an authentic Egyptian restaurant and then head over to the New Grand Egyptian Museum, also known as the Giza Museum, which is an archaeological museum in Giza, Egypt, about 2 kilometers (1.2 miles) from the Giza pyramid complex. The GEM Complex is now offering limited access to test site readiness and the visitor experience ahead of the official opening. Admission is currently limited to the Main Galleries, Grand Hall, Grand Staircase, commercial area, and exterior gardens. Later, you will be transferred to the gorgeous Giza railway station to catch the sleeper train from Cairo to Luxor. Dinner will be served on board. Overnight inside your compartment. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch. Visits: Great Pyramids of Giza, Sphinx, Valley Temple, Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM).

Arrive at Luxor train station where you will be met & assisted then transferred to enjoy an excursion to two of the most interesting tombs at the West Bank of the Nile River, the Valley of the Kings, the Temple of Hatshepsut, the powerful Egyptian queen, and the Colossi of Memnon. Then visit the splendid Luxor Temple, considered the greatest open-air museum and probably the second most visited historical site in Egypt, Karnak Temples. Back to hotel and overnight in Luxor. Meals: Breakfast

After breakfast transfer by air-conditioned vehicle to Aswan about a 5 hours drive from Luxor to Aswan. Upon arrival, you will be met and taken to your hotel for check-in. See the Unfinished Obelisk, then on to the beautiful located Temple of Philae on Isis Island and the Granite Quarries, which is dedicated to the goddesses Isis and Hathor. Sail and move around Elephantine Island by a felucca boat. Back to hotel and overnight in Aswan. Meals: Breakfast

Breakfast box, at 03:30 am start your trip to Abu Simbel Temples. It takes about a 3 hour and half drive one way from Aswan to Abu Simbel by a private air-conditioned vehicle. Upon arrival at Abu Simbel, enjoy the impressive Temples of Ramses II at Abu Simbel, which is dedicated to the four universal gods Ptah, Re-Harakhte, Amun-Re, and to Ramesses II. Then return to Aswan. After that transfer to Aswan railway station for departure to Cairo. Sleeping train from Aswan to Cairo is about 14 hours. Overnight on board the train. Meals: Breakfast, Dinner

Breakfast aboard sleeper train before arriving Giza train station, where you will be met and assisted by our representative who will transfer you to your hotel for free time at leisure( you will check into your room as early as possible ) with some optional excursions available in Cairo to visit Step Pyramids of King Zoser in Sakkara and Memphis.Overnight stay at your hotel in Cairo. Meals: Breakfast

Free day in Cairo or optional trip to Alexandria, to visit its famous sights, where you can see Qaitbay Fort, built in the 15th century by Sultan Qaitbay on the spot of Alexandria's ancient lighthouse. Stop and move around the grand Montazah Palace, which combines Turkish and Florentine architectural styles, then move on to the new and much-acclaimed Alexandria Library. Also visit the Roman cemetery cut out of the rock, the Catacombs. Overnight in Cairo. Meals: Breakfast
Breakfast, transfer to Cairo International Airport for final departure. Meals: Breakfast

tourName: Advanced diving holidays in Dahab
generalInfo:
ADVANCED
This dive holiday takes you to new levels in diving. Your PADI Advanced course will introduce you to dives you have never tried before such as night diving, drift and naturalist dives, as well as covering mandatory dives in deep and navigation. All our courses come with PADI e-learning included, so you can do your theory before you come and just focus on enjoying your diving.
It is also a great excuse to see some the most amazing, world famous dive sites: Blue Hole, Canyon, Islands and many more, in the safe hands of your PADI Instructor.
You will feel much more confident as your diving progresses and also benefit from our small numbers 4-1 of instructor to diver ratios.
Your base throughout your holiday will be a home from home, in our cosy clean eco-boutique family-run resort. We are lucky enough to be based on the beach of the famous Eel Garden site in Dahab, Red Sea. We are located at the quieter end of the seafront, but still less than 5 minutes’ walk from the restaurants, bars, shops and bustle of the main bay of Dahab.
While staying with us, there are several accommodation options available within our resort including 2 Seaside Rooms, 4 Garden chalets and 2 Suites with 2 bedrooms each, one affording magnificent views over the Red Sea with a private terrace and a ground floor suite one with lots of space for storage, ideal for families.
All our rooms are fitted with air cons, clean modern bathrooms with shower cubicles, fridges (with complimentary snacks), water dispensers, as well as a fully stocked tea & coffee tray and kettle.
You can choose to include the breakfast as part of your package, along with airport transfers, laundry and a Bedouin dinner in the mountains, just ask us for details.

Our restaurant is open all day, serving freshly cooked dishes such as wraps, burgers, pizza or more substantial dishes, which you can enjoy on the beach.

Please get in touch with us for the latest prices and flight advice.

dayInfo.description: This is your first day of diving. After your breakfast on the beach. After you have complete the dive paperwork, we will set your equipment up for you and off you go for your first 'refresher' or 'reactivate' dive, depending on how long it was since you last dived.

Your first big day of diving. Usually we start with the navigation dive, where you learn essential skills in navigating both underwater and above. Your second dive of the day will be peak performance buoyancy...lots of fun to visit the underwater buoyancy park in the Lighthouse dive site.

Off to see the most famous dive sites in Dahab: Canyon and The Blue Hole…both spectacular in their own way. The Canyon (Deep Dive) is a narrow crack in the reef table that you can dive in, past thousands of tiny bubbles left by the other divers. For the Blue Hole, we enter from ‘The Bells’ a chimney tunnel, followed by drifting past the biggest drop off of 1000 meters plus (we do not go below 30 meters recreational limit for any dive) We normally fit the night dive in on this day @ The Lighthouse (it has to be a dive site with a clear bottom, which you have dived before)

Visit the Islands for a memorable, beautiful shallow dive, a chance to see different fish species not seen elsewhere such as the schooling ‘Yellow Tailed Barracuda’ and if you are lucky a Turtle. This would be an option for your naturalist dive, or just a fun dive once you have completed your course.

Flex your newly acquired dive skills with a spot of chilled out fun diving. Now you can go to depths of up to 30 meters and can navigate your way around. Exercise your new level of confidence with some fun dives and see some of the best diving the world has to offer: Wadi Gunai, 3 Pools, Mashruba (full of crazy statues) Ricks Reef ( a great drift dive which goes past the Canyon) Abu Helal, Abu Talal and many more. n.b. dives do depend on conditions

It doesn’t have to be all about the diving, depending on when you visit, you can also enjoy a trip to the desert (Oct-April) OR some extra activities such as horse riding or camel riding. Tis might be a good night to do your Bedouin Dinner (included in your package) where we take you to a beautiful area of the desert about 30 minutes from us and you can enjoy home cooked food from the fire, lots of Bedouin Tea and the 1000’s of stars or Moon….truly inspiring. You can also pay a supplement to have a camel meet you at the entry to the Wadi and walk in like the ancient Bedouins have done for 1000’s of years.

Due to flying after diving regulations; you will need to allow a minimum of 18-24 hours between diving and flying… so maybe make your last day one of relaxation, snorkel the Eel Garden Reef and check out the shops, in the evening, for some beautiful hand crafted gifts in the bay of Dahab to take back to friends and family.

tourName: Ancient Egypt guided tour
generalInfo:
The holiday has been crafted to showcase the very best that Egypt has to offer. A 5 Star experience which has you spending 3 days in Cairo and then onto your wonderous Nile River Cruise.

Egypt stands alone in having the only remaining relic of the 7 Wonders of the World, the amazing pyramids at Giza. And the historical legacy that the ancient Egyptians left the world are showcased in this amazing holiday. It will leave you with memories of a lifetime and is the ultimate bucket list destination. It’s a Nile Cruise through the history of Ancient Egypt.

The Essential Aspects of this Itinerary Are
5 Stars All The Way

• 5 Star Luxury Class for your Nile Cruise
Concierge Service in Cairo

• You will be ushered with priority through Customs and Immigration - no more waiting in long queues.
• All transfers will be accompanied by our staff and in air-conditioned comfort.

An App Which Keeps You in Contact with Love Ones

dayInfo.description: Arrival Into Cairo and Your Accommodation. Meet and Greet At Cairo Airport: Our representative will be on hand to facilitate your transit through Customs and Immigration. Transfers and Free Time: Our representative will travel with you from the airport to your hotel to ensure a smooth transition and booking in process. Time to rest up in preparation for the start of your trip.

The First of 2 Incredible Days in Cairo. Saqqara - The Saqqara area is the most researched archaeological site in Egypt with recent excavations undercovering new tombs previously unknown. Pyramids of Giza - Khufu, Khafre and Menkaure are over 4500 years old and are a testament to ancient Egyptians skills. The Sphinx - much is still to be learnt about the building of the sphinx and what it represents. Transfer and overnight - the second of 3 nights at the Cairo Marriott (Nile River) 5 Star Hotel or equivalent. B L included - Dinner at Own Expense.

Where History, Culture and Adventure Converge. National Museum of Egyptian Civilisation- The museum houses over 30 mummies as well as hundreds of artefacts that showcase Egyptian civilisation. Coptic Cairo is a part of Old Cairo. It is believed in Christian tradition that the Holy Family visited this area and stayed at the site of Saints Sergius and Bacchus Church. The Muhammed Ali Mosque: This mosque with its animated silhouette and twin minarets, is the most visible mosque in Cairo. Transfer and overnight - the third of 3 nights at the Cairo Marriott (Nile River) 5 Star Hotel B L included - Dinner at Own Expense.

Today You Fly to Aswan to Join Your Nile Cruise. Breakfast at the hotel - transfer to Cairo Airport for your flight to Aswan. Aswan Dam and Elephantine Island: The dam is the world’s largest embankment dam. And today, you will embark on a 1-hour sail on a traditional Egyptian craft called a felucca. A water's view before your excursion to the Philae temple complex. Philae Temple Complex: According to the legend, Philae is the place where Isis found the heart of Osiris and then buried it on the Island. Transfer to your cruise vessel and overnight - the first of 3 nights. B L D Included

Leisurely Cruising And Amazing Sites. You will visit: Abu Simbel The pharaoh Ramses II built the temple in 1200 BC. It was relocated to its current site when the Aswan Dam was built. The Temple was dedicated for four Egyptian deities by Ramses II including Amun-Ra, Re-Horakhty and Ramses II himself. Temple Kombo Ombo: Located on the banks of the Nile in a village of the same name, Kom Ombo is unique in Egypt as a double temple - dedicated to two deities, Sobek and Horus. Transfer to your cruise vessel and overnight - the second of 3 nights. B L D Included

Where the History Flows and Captivates. The Great Temples of Karnak and Luxor: Karnak is an ancient Egyptian temple precinct located on the east bank of the Nile River in Thebes (modern-day Luxor). It covers more than 100 hectares, and is an extraordinary complex of sanctuaries, kiosks, pylons and obelisks dedicated to the pharaohs. Transfer to your cruise vessel and overnight- the third and last night on the cruise vessel. B L D Included

A Spectacular Day. The Valley of the Kings: The Valley is where rock-cut tombs were excavated for pharaohs in the New Kingdom. The Valley of the Workers: This is an ancient workmen's village which was home to the artisans who worked on the tombs. The Temple of Hatshebut Queen Hatshepsut's temple was built to tell Hatshepsut's life story and to assert her power. B L included - Dinner at Own Expense. Transfers and Flights: You will transfer to the airport for your flight to Cairo and overnight at \the Cairo Marriott Hotel - 5 stars Specify the day(s) and details in the boxes then click Update

And Perhaps Some Last-Minute Shopping. Breakfast in the hotel. Checkout: Checkout times can be discussed with the hotel but are typically between 11 am and noon. Depending on your departure time, it may be that you would like to relax or have a shopping experience at the Khan El Khalili Bazaar . Transfers and Flights: You will transfer to Cairo International Airport for your ongoing journey. End of Tour.

dayInfo.description: Arrival Cairo - Welcome to land of the Pharaoh’s. Welcome to Cairo, Egypt. Your Representative will meet and assist you at Cairo International Airport (Arrival procedures) and then escort you to the Hotel by exclusive air-conditioned deluxe vehicle. At the Hotel the your Representative will assist with a smooth check-in and review the holiday itinerary with you to establish and confirm pick-up times for each tour. Overnight in Cairo. Welcome Drink.

Egypt Pyramids Tour. Breakfast at your Hotel in Cairo and then met by your personal experienced Tour Guide who will accompany you to Giza Plateau to visit the Great Pyramids of Cheops, Chefren and Mykerinus - Famous Sphinx and Valley Temple facing the great statue, Lunch will be served in a local restaurant, then proceed to Sakkara area to visit the Sakkara Complex and first Pyramid ever built (Djoser Pyramid), Back to your Hotel and overnight in Cairo. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch.

Cairo Sightseeing Tours. Check-out after breakfast and then you will be escorted by your a private Guide to visit the Egyptian Museum, Lunch throughout the tour at local restaurant, Continue to Coptic Cairo to visit the Hanging Church. Continue driving to Islamic Cairo, where you will be able to explore Khan El Khalili, Cairo’s old bazaar. Then you will be transferred back to your hotel and overnight in Cairo. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch.

Fly Cairo to Amman - Hello Jordan. After breakfast, you will be transferred to Cairo International Airport for your flight to Amman. Upon arrival at Queen Alia Airport, our Representative will meet and assist you through the customs and immigration procedures. Transfer to the Hotel in Amman for overnight. Meals: Breakfast.

Madaba - Dead Sea Tour. After breakfast drive to Mount Nebo, the place where Prophet Moses gazed at the promised land before he died and his alleged burial place. You will visit the old Monastery and overlook the Jordan Valley, Dead Sea, Jericho and Jerusalem. After we proceed to Madaba, where you will find the famous mosaic 6th century map of Palestine in St. George’s Church. Afterward we drive to the lowest point on earth, the Dead Sea, where you have leisure time and the chance to float on water. Overnight Amman hotel. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch.

Ancient City of Petra Tour. After breakfast drive about 2 hours to the Rose Red Rock City Petra, the biggest attraction in Jordan. Petra was first established around the 6th century B.C. by the Nabataean Arabs, a nomadic tribe who settled in the area and laid the foundations of a commercial empire that extended into Syria. Upon arrival you will begin the trip on horseback or foot to the canyon, the so called Siq Then by foot to the most beautiful monument: the Treasury. Among other monuments you will see are the Street of Facades, the Royal Tombs and Pharaoh"s Castle. Afterward back to the hotel in Amman for overnight. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch.
Amman - Fly Back Home. After breakfast you will be transferred to Queen Alia Airport for final departure. Meals: Breakfast.

tourName: Cairo & Alexandria holiday, Egypt
generalInfo:
This journey offers a balanced introduction to Egypt through its two most historic cities, Cairo and Alexandria. Designed by local travel experts who live and work in Egypt, the trip combines world-famous sites with a relaxed pace and time to understand everyday life.

You will explore the great monuments of ancient Egypt, such as the pyramids and Saqqara, while also discovering Cairo’s historic districts, local neighbourhoods and Alexandria’s Mediterranean character. There is time to walk, sit in local cafés and experience daily life alongside guided cultural visits.

Throughout the trip, you are accompanied by experienced local guides who provide context, stories and insights beyond the guidebooks. The itinerary is ideal for travellers who want to experience Egypt’s history and culture in depth, without rushing, and with enough free time to absorb the atmosphere of each place.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Cairo International Airport, where you will be met and assisted before being transferred to your hotel. The rest of the day is free to relax after your journey.

After breakfast, meet your Egyptologist guide and visit the Pyramids of Giza, one of the most iconic sites in the world. Continue to the Grand Egyptian Museum, including the impressive Grand Staircase. Return to your hotel for the evening.

After a delicious breakfast, you explore some of Egypt’s earliest capitals and burial grounds. Visit Memphis, the ancient capital, and Saqqara, home to the Step Pyramid of Djoser. Continue to Dahshur to see the Red Pyramid, an important milestone in pyramid construction. Return to your hotel for the evening.

Get your breakfast, travel by vehicle to Alexandria on the Mediterranean coast (approximately three hours). Visit key sites such as the Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa and Pompey’s Pillar, followed by lunch during the tour. Check in to your hotel and enjoy a relaxed evening at leisure.

After breakfast, check out and explore Alexandria’s highlights including the Bibliotheca Alexandrina and the Qaitbay Citadel, built on the site of the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria. Enjoy lunch during the tour. In the late afternoon, return by vehicle to Cairo for overnight stay.

Breakfast, then visit the Citadel of Salah El-Din and the Mosque of Mohamed Ali. Continue to Old Cairo, visiting historic religious sites, and explore Khan El-Khalili Bazaar to experience local life and crafts. Return to hotel for overnight stay.
Transfer to Cairo Airport for your return flight, carrying with you the spirit of Egypt, its timeless history, stories, and endless beauty.

The experience then shifts to the peaceful landscapes of Bahariya Oasis, offering a slower pace and a completely different side of Egypt. Designed by local experts, the trip balances history, nature, and light adventure, while allowing time to relax, enjoy desert scenery, and experience Egypt beyond the usual tourist routes. It is ideal for travellers looking for cultural depth combined with authentic desert exploration.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Cairo International Airport, meet & assist through arrival formalities. Transfer to your hotel, check in, and enjoy a relaxed evening. Overnight stay in Cairo.

After breakfast, embark on a 4x4 safari into the White Desert, exploring unique rock formations such as Mushroom Rock, Crystal Mountain, and Agabat Valley, that includes a (light lunch). Later in the afternoon, return to Cairo by air-conditioned vehicle. Check in at your hotel and overnight stay.

tourName: Cairo holiday in Egypt
generalInfo: If you want to Discover Egypt's top attractions in Cairo, then this 4 day Cairo to Cairo Egypt tour is perfect for you. Cairo, a city unlike any other in the world, boasts a rich history spanning over seven centuries as the largest urban center in both Africa and the Middle East. Its allure to tourists transcends time, drawing visitors from all corners of the globe. Embark on a captivating journey through Egypt's vibrant capital, offering a glimpse into its bustling streets and iconic landmarks, ideal for travelers seeking a memorable experience within limited time constraints or those who have explored other regions of Egypt. Begin your expedition with a guided exploration of Egypt's most iconic marvels—the Great Pyramids of Giza and the enigmatic Sphinx. Delve into the mysteries shrouding these ancient wonders, marveling at their architectural grandeur and historical significance. Venture further into Egypt's past with a visit to the distinctive Step Pyramid at Saqqara, a testament to the evolution of pyramid construction techniques and a window into the country's rich heritage. Embrace the pulse of Cairo on a comprehensive city tour, immersing yourself in its cultural tapestry. Explore the vast Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM) of antiquities, housing treasures that chronicle millennia of civilization. Ascend the imposing Citadel, an architectural masterpiece commanding panoramic views of the cityscape. Traverse the labyrinthine streets to discover several mosques or opt for a journey through the historic enclave of Coptic Cairo. Dive into the vibrant ambiance of the Khan-el-Khalili bazaar, where a myriad of sights, sounds, and scents beckon. As dusk descends, embark on a leisurely dinner cruise along the timeless waters of the Nile. Indulge in sumptuous cuisine as traditional Sufi dancers enchant with their mesmerizing performances, while exotic belly dancers captivate with their rhythmic movements, adding an extra layer of enchantment to your evening. Retreat to the comfort of a welcoming 3-star hotel nestled in the upscale district of Mohandiseen. Discover a plethora of shops, cafes, and restaurants within easy reach, enhancing your stay with convenience and charm. Elevate your accommodation experience with optional upgrades to a selection of distinguished 4 or 5-star hotels, tailored to suit your preferences and desires. In Cairo, every corner unveils a new chapter in the timeless saga of human civilization, offering an unforgettable sojourn through history, culture, and enchantment

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Egypt & transfer to hotel You arrive at Cairo airport where we greet and transfer you to your hotel. Our local rep. welcomes you, helps you settle into the hotel, and outlines the plan for the next few days. | OVERNIGHT

Visit the Pyramids, Sphinx & Saqqara After breakfast we have a brief pre-tour briefing before we take you on a tour of Gisa and Saqqara. Gisa was built around 4600 years ago as a necropolis (cemetery) for the pharaoh Khufu (Cheops). The successor of Sneferu, Khufu was known as a tyrant and in his arrogance decided to have built a tomb that was bigger and better than all others. Standing 500 feet high and 750 feet at its base the Pyramid of Khufu is an awesome man-made structure constructed of giant blocks of stone covered in a hard limestone casing. The casing has, over the years, been stripped away to leave exposed the inner block structure. Together with the smaller pyramids of Khafre (Chephern) and Menkaure (Mycerinus), the majestic sight of these enormous structures rising out of the desert is a breathtaking spectacle. Here you have the chance to climb inside one of the pyramids (there are a limited number of tickets available, so we cannot guarantee this). You have another guided tour around the sphinx and some free time to walk around and take photos. From here we take you to Saqqara, which lies 25km to the south of Cairo. Djeser's (Zoser's) Step Pyramid (built 4700 years ago) dominates the skyline and is believed to have been the ancient Egyptians' first attempt at Pyramid building. The entire 7km stretch of desert at Saqqara is a treasure trove of pyramids, temples and tombs, which we will have plenty of time to explore, while we learn about the history of pyramid building in Egypt. | OVERNIGHT

Cairo city tour & dinner cruise After breakfast we begin our tour of Cairo. Founded in 969 AD by Gohar, a Fatimid army leader, El Kahera (Cairo) soon became the capital of Egypt. Subsequent additions like the El Azhar mosque, the Islamic University, and defensive walls and a citadel, built by Saladin in 1179, have helped Cairo remain Egypt's principal city. The 16-year reign of Ismail (1830-1895) ushered in a new period of expansion and modernisation in Cairo. Areas like Heliopolis, Dokki and Roda were added, while gardens, Opera houses, large hotels and wide, tree lined avenues were built. Further post revolutionary, urban expansion has left Cairo as one of the world's largest cities. Today it is a bustling metropolis of over 20 million people, a strange mix of modern and old, a unique blend of diverse cultures and a gateway to Egypt's past. Your tour includes a visit to the Grand Egyptian Museum (GEM) (which houses a vast collection of artefacts from Egypt's past, including the famous King Tutunkhamun display), the Citadel (a collection of mosques and palaces, with a great view over the city), and the Khan al Khalili bazaar (a mazy market that offers a window to the past and a guaranteed souvenir). Finally, this evening we enjoy a dinner cruise on the River Nile. During the meal, there will be a display by local Sufi and belly dancers. | OVERNIGHT

Transfer to the airport for departure Your tour ends today and your time is free until we transfer you back to Cairo airport for your flight home. As this is a private tour, we can be as flexible with the itinerary as you wish, and extra nights in Cairo can be added as well as further day trips and tours. For example, you could visit the colonial city of Alexandria on the Mediterranean coast, or head into the deserts near Cairo to visit the World Heritage Site of the Valley of the Whales. | OVERNIGHT
